description:
This is a moderately difficult trail in Yoho National Park (B.C.) to a nice quiet lake. Quiet because very few people seem to hike in Yoho, possibly because it's small and right on the Trans-Canada. We did it in mid-August and the trail and the lake were all ours. The trail climbs almost all the way but is not really difficult. 
About 2km in, there is a branch right to a lookout on Paget Peak (difficult). 
Return the way you came.
In winter please check the Avaluator
(Online Trip Planner) rating is: 
 Complex.  
See more trip planner route details here.
directions: Trailhead is at the Wapta Lake picnic area on the north side of Hwy 1, 11km east of Field, B.C.
title: Sherbrooke Lake
